section.heading: Limitations on military weaponry acquired by District law enforcement agencies.

para.text: Beginning in Fiscal Year 2021, District law enforcement agencies shall not acquire the following property through any program operated by the federal government:
Armed or armored vehicles, including aircraft and watercraft;
Objects designed or capable of launching explosives or pyrotechnics, including grenade launchers, firearms, and firearms accessories; and
Remotely piloted, powered aircraft without a crew aboard, including drones.
If a District law enforcement agency:

Requests property through a program operated by the federal government, the District law enforcement agency shall publish notice of the request on a publicly accessible website within 14 days after the date of the request; or

Acquires property through a program operated by the federal government, the District law enforcement agency shall publish notice of the acquisition on a publicly accessible website within 14 days after the date of the acquisition.
Within 180 days after July 22, 2020, District law enforcement agencies shall:
Return or dispose of any property described in subsection (a) of this section that the agencies currently possess; and
Publish an inventory of the property returned or disposed of as described in paragraph (1) of this subsection on a publicly accessible website.
